runs.comm: quiet start from Steyn, landing it fullish and wide of off stump, Gayle shoulders his enormous arms and it passes through to the keeper
over adjusts this time, slipping it down the leg side, where De Villiers tumbles and fumbles, allowing a sneaky bye
another wide, this time outside off stump, it actually moved a long way off the pitch, and the under-pressure Fletcher let it go past
definite seam movement, jagging away from outside off stump, left alone once more
fuller this time, and straighter, Fletcher manages to lean gently into a push to the covers
beaten! Good ball, swing away late from an inviting, full length, Fletcher gropes at it and it zips past the edge
Fletcher is off the mark, which is rare for him of late, it wasn't with utter conviction mind, outside-edging a fullish swinging delivery down to third man

Steyn strikes! Trouble for West Indies, as their captain departs. It kept low but Gayle should have been playing forward, fullish, swinging in and trapping Gayle in front of leg stump. Good decision from the umpire there
runs for Fletcher! The left-armer angled one right across him and he slashed through the line, trusting the bounce to send the ball behind point
good shot from Bravo, pushing down the ground and mid off is quite deep, so they have time to push through for one
Tsotsobe bangs it in back of a length, Fletcher stands up tall to ride the bounce and push the ball into the covers
well, that one has kept really low! Fletcher was into the pull shot but the ball whizzed past his shins. He's really lucky that wasn't aimed at the stumps, that really crept through
and this one has leapt of an almost identical length to the last one! Fletcher came forward and the ball reared up on him, beating the edge
Fletcher is looking really uncertain now, this is driven half-heartedly and in the air out into the covers, luckily it's timed so badly it doesn't reach the fielder
on a length to start, Bravo pushes back to the bowler
fuller, Bravo drives to the on side with real flourish, but straight to the fielder
back of a length now, and Bravo gets inside it to nudge the ball to leg and pick up a run
awkwardly played by Fletcher. He wasn't sure whether to come forward or back to a length ball, and ended up poking at it rooted to the crease

gone this time, and South Africa must've seen this one coming. Morkel banged the ball in short, Fletcher tried to pull but his weight was forward, and he sent a spiralling top edge straight up in the air. Easy catch for de Villiers
length, dropped down to point
Tsotsobe hits a length on off stump, Chanderpaul pushes forward but pulls his bat inside the line at the last moment to leave
full and hooping away from the left-hander through the air, Chanderpaul drives watchfully into the off side
seaming in to the batsman this side, he clips to leg but picks out the square leg fielder
the ball spits up off a length, but Chanderpaul keeps his eye on it to send it down to third man for one
full and wide, moving further away after pitching and Bravo aims an optimistic drive through the covers, missing the ball completely
edged! But that's dropped just short of de Villiers, who tumbled forward to try and get to the ball. It just died on him in the air though, dropping agonisingly short of his outstretched glove
that'll ease the pressure a touch! The bowler strays onto Shiv's legs and he clips handsomely up and over deep square leg. Four valuable runs for West Indies
squeezed out behind square on the leg side, the sprint through for one
tip and run from Bravo, as he taps the ball towards mid on and sets off straight away. Good running, they were well in in the end
Morkel comes round the wicket, slamming the ball down on a length, Chanderpaul leaves well alone
replay of the last ball, this one seamed in an inch or two but again Chanderpaul shouldered arms
off the inside edge and trickling out on the off side, no run taken
full, fast and swinging from Steyn. Bravo pushes to mid on
short from Steyn, and that was on to Bravo in a flash, beating his pull to take the splice and loop towards mid on, dropping short though
that's better, they don't need to unleash the big shots yet. Bravo just opens the face to run the ball down to third man
swinging down leg, flicks the pad on the way through to de Villiers
full and speared at the legs once more, Chanderpaul is struck on the pads and Steyn lets loose with a huge appeal. Pitched well outside leg though, not even considered by the umpire
length on off stump, Chanderpaul gets forward in defence
clipped to square leg first ball, Bravo wants a run but Chanderpaul sends him back - and rightly so
Botha finds the perfect length, Bravo defends from the crease
and again, same ball, same shot
Bravo uses his feet this time to try and upset the bowler's rhythm - and get to the pitch of course, which he does, sending the ball out to long on
Chanderpaul stays deep in the crease, dropping the ball behind square on the off side, and they sneak a single. Good batting, just rotating the strike and keeping the score ticking over
just a touch too full, Bravo gets across and drives well down to long on
and McLaren's first ball of the match is a perfect bouncer! Bravo just about sways out the way, and they steal a bye as de Villiers leaps in the air to cut the ball off
a shuffling, crab-like shot from Chanderpaul as he tries to tuck the ball behind square, but he can't get it away
Chanders is looking for the single, but it's just so hard to find placement or timing on this pitch. A one-handed drive goes straight to mid off
back of a length, angling across from over the wicket, and Chanderpaul is beaten on the cut
pitching leg and moving to off, Chanderpaul is squared up a little as he pats the ball down in awkward defence

very, very sharp single as Chanderpaul rolled his wrist over a length ball to try and find space on the leg side. McLaren sprinted through after his follow through, rolling and hurling the ball at the stumps. Had he hit, the batsman was out
pushed out softly through the covers, one run the result
Bravo skips down the pitch and clips to leg but picks out straight midwicket
and so this time he chips over that man, they sprint through for one as a rocket-like throw from Dale Steyn comes in right over the stumps
bunted down to long off off the front foot
Botha slips onto Bravo's pads, and the batsman clips elegantly out to deep square leg
arm ball from Botha, who's come round the wicket to Chanderpaul. Chanders shuffles across and nudges to leg, they run another single
full and pushed down to long off for another single
there's the big shot! McLaren hurled down a bumper, but Bravo was immediately onto the back foot and pulling very hard out to deep midwicket. The fielder cuts it off though, so just two

dropped! The ball was full and Bravo went for a flashing square drive, sending the ball in the air to van der Merwe at backward point. He hit it really hard though and the fielder, tumbling over, couldn't hold on
nudged into the covers, no run
slower cutter from McLaren, running the fingers over that one as Chanderpaul on-drives down to long on
and Bravo mirrors his shot to send the ball out to the long on fielder and keep the strike
and he's immediately run very fine down to fine leg for a pressure-relieving boundary! Tsotsobe got his line all wrong there, and all Bravo needed to do was get something on it.
Bravo beaten outside off stump this time!
Bravo throws everything into an attempted lofted off drive, the resultant thick edge flies down to third man, where a misfield from Bosman allows them back for two
chipped down the ground, Bravo was aiming for the straight boundary but found long off, ball dropping well short though and quick running gets West Indies two more
Bravo aims a drive through the covers, the ball squirts off the inside edge and they pick up one to midwicket
full and coming in to Chanderpaul with the angle from over the wicket, pushed to point off the front foot
Bravo flashes outside off without moving his feet and is beaten
offcutter from Steyn this time, and it's kept low too! Bravo gets bat on it though, and they take one as the midwicket fielder runs in
full toss outside off stump, Chanderpaul could have done more with that, but ended up just pushing it out into the covers for one. That was a boundary ball
great bouncer from Steyn! Right past Bravo's helmet as he tried to hook to fine leg
six runs! Bravo has taken Steyn on, he's taken the long on fielder on, and he's pulled off the shot superbly! This ball was fuller and Bravo crashed it way over the boundary for a vital six runs
he's middling them now! This one is meated out to point, there's a fielder out there so just the one run
Bravo backs away, giving himself acres of room but he's beaten as the ball shoots through very low indeed! The ball went between the batsman and the stumps
Morkel loses his radar with this one, hurling it down the leg side
banged in at the hips, Bravo gets across and drops the ball behind square
Chanderpaul drops the ball very close on the off side, they think about the run but the fielder was in in a flash. A loud "no!" from Bravo
ambitious shot from Chanderpaul, as he went right across to the off side and tried to paddle-pull down to fine leg, couldn't connect though and is struck on the body
there's that variable bounce again! The ball was quite full - not a half volley by any means but close to the batsman - and it just leapt off the length, beating Chanderpaul all ends up
very full - almost yorker length - and Chanderpaul digs it out on the off side for one

there's the shot Chanderpaul was trying to play in the last over, but this time he's nailed it! He knew fine leg was up and he went right across his stumps to lift the ball up and over the fielder. Great, innovative shot and another crucial boundary for West Indies
wow, reverse-paddle from Chanderpaul now! He was lucky to get his pad in the way of that one...
and again he tries to reverse-sweep the tall fast bowler! He hasn't got any bat on this one either, he's taken a blow to the wrist and they scamper through
Bravo goes aerial after the break! He was trying to lift the ball over the off side field, he did that but didn't middle it, and luckily the ball fell between the fielders

slower cutter from Tsotsobe, and Bravo is really going for it now! Huge wind-up to the shot, and he's absolutely murdered this one over long off. That looks to have gone up into the second tier of the stands!
another cutter, the length is better this time though, and Bravo can only tap the ball awkwardly back to the bowler
Chanderpaul! The fans are starting to believe now! That was too short from Botha, and Chanderpaul leapt back into position to pull, biffing up and over wide long on
chipped back to the bowler and the ball crashes into the stumps. Bowler didn't get a hand to it though, diving over the top of the ball
sharp running! The ball was smacked out into the outfield but the fielder was onto it in milliseconds, they went for the second run and just scampered back in time

there's the wicket South Africa needed! And West Indies could be in trouble now... Chanderpaul went down to reverse sweep but the ball looped up off the glove, de Villiers running back to take an easy catch
pushed down to long on
and Pollard responds by clipping straight to the midwicket fielder
massive mow from Bravo, the ball balloons off the top edge down to third man
Pollard shuffles down the wicket, McLaren fires it wide of off and he shoulders arms
dropped! Pollard went for a flashing drive, slicing across the ball to send a catch out to deep point. The fielder fluffed the chance though - Tsotsobe it was. Hard chance, but should've been taken
half volley, on the toes and Pollard crunches a muscly lofted drive out to wide long on. The power in that shot was just phenomenal, it flew off the bat!
short this time, and pulled out to the deep square leg fielder
low full toss outside off stump, Bravo drives out to the cover sweeper, taking his bottom hand off the bat as he does so

Bravo goes! The ball was pitched up and he threw everything, and the kitchen sink, into a hoick to midwicket. The ball went miles up in the air, Botha the fielder circling underneath it, and he managed to hold on to the chance. Botha let out a battle-cry after he took the catch, you could see how important Bravo's wicket was to South Africa
flung wide down the leg side
again angling leg side, but straight and fast enough to beat the bat and thump into the thigh pad

phew, very nearly a run-out there! Pollard shaped to flick a length ball to leg, the ball took the edge, hit the pad and went to the off side. Sarwan called him through but there was some very confused running, eventually Pollard made it to the other side as the return came in
on a length, flicked to leg but can't get off the mark
Sarwan backs away to leg, Morkel follows him with a back of a length delivery that jagged in, no run
just full enough for the drive, and Sarwan followed through with the shot to send the ball up and over the cover field, bouncing just short of the boundary to ruin what was a superb over!
drop down behind point, Sarwan calls straight away and they hurry through
dropped on the leg side now by Sarwan, Steyn sprinted for the ball but slipped on the practice wicket

Steyn's not happy here! He fired in the yorker, Pollard jammed down on it and they set off immediately, Steyn ran for the ball which had dropped close to the stumps but Pollard just ran straight into and through him!
crashed out on the off side, the cover sweeper cuts it off
full and very wide of off, Pollard swings mightily but can't lay bat on ball

Pollard has swung so hard at that, the bat flew out of his hands! It was very full - a yorker that crept under the bat as he heaved with his head in the air, the bat flew up and landed somewhere near de Villiers... Steyn gets a word in Pollard's ear about his technique, and the weather.
Sarwan goes! They had to go for everything, Sarwan tried to lift the ball over midwicket but hit into the breeze, McLaren takes an easy catch
short, and smacked in the air to McLaren again! It was wide of him this time though, and in the end he did really well to stop it from reaching the boundary
another wicket falls, West Indies' chase is unravelling now. Pollard tried to swing Botha out of the ground straight but got right underneath it. Steyn gets underneath it to take a simple catch
byes! Four of them! Valuable runs as Botha fires in a quicker one, beating batsman and keeper
crunched down the ground for one
full toss bunted down the ground, but Steyn runs round from long on to keep it to two
hoicked out to deep midwicket, there's a fielder out there but they take an easy two

very high full toss, Sammy aims an almighty heave to midwicket and the ball flies off the top edge down to third man for four! He's asking about the no-ball for height, but that'll just be the four runs

another high full toss, Sammy hammers it down the ground! Amazing running and the crowd has gone mental! They've somehow squeezed four runs out of that, two to long off, and two more off overthrows as the return came in wide of de Villiers. Sammy is down and hurt, he's done himself a mischief. What drama! The crowd has come alive and they're right behind the home side now
pinpoint yorker, hoicked away by Sammy, but they can only get one to square leg! That was the best he could do with that, great bowling
low full toss thrashed out to deep midwicket, they've got to go for two, they do! de Villiers breaks the stumps, and Deonarine's bat is in the air as he slides over the line!

South Africa win! McLaren fired in a low full toss very wide of off stump, Taylor threw the bat at it but could only send the ball as far as the point fielder, they can only run one and South Africa win the game by one run
